design_system.critique: The current 'Material Default' (Blue-Grey/Teal) is too passive and generic. It signals 'documentation site' rather than 'surgical engineering tool'. For a tool named 'The Janitor' that deletes code, the aesthetic should be 'Clinical Industrial'â€”high contrast, sharp edges, and warning colors.
design_system.css_overrides: :root { --md-primary-fg-color: #000000; --md-primary-bg-color: #ffffff; --md-accent-fg-color: #FF3300; } .md-typeset h1, .md-typeset h2 { text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: -0.05em; font-weight: 800; } .md-content { border-left: 1px solid #333; } .md-sidebar { border-right: 1px solid #333; } .md-typeset pre { border: 1px solid #333; border-radius: 0px; } .md-button { border-radius: 0px; font-weight: bold; text-transform: uppercase; border: 1px solid currentColor; }

functional_gaps.description: An interactive slider where users input their codebase size (LOC) and team size. It calculates 'Estimated Dead Code' (typically 15-30%) and 'Annual Wasted Engineering Hours'.
Replace static code blocks with a 'Before/After' toggle switch that visually highlights the deleted lines in red and the preserved logic in green, mimicking a GitHub Pull Request UI.
A micro-interaction showing a terminal window animation where a file is deleted, a test fails, and the system auto-rolls back in real-time. This builds trust in the 'Zero-Fear' claim.

conversion_optimization.pricing_strategy: Reframe from 'Buying a Zip File' to 'Insuring the Codebase'.

display_changes.implementation: Introduce a third tier: 'Enterprise' (Contact Sales). This makes the $49 Premium tier look like the rational, high-value choice compared to the 'Free' tier.
Change 'Premium Wisdom Packs' to 'The Janitor: Pro License'. 'Wisdom Pack' sounds like a video game DLC. 'Pro License' sounds like a tool requirement.
Use a 3-column pricing table. The Pro column should be slightly elevated, have a 'Most Popular' badge in the accent color, and the CTA button should say 'Secure My Codebase' instead of 'Buy Now'.
Add logos of the frameworks supported (Django, Next.js, AWS) directly inside the pricing card to visually validate the value.
